distribution.text: Copyright 2023 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update for ghostscript to version 9.26 fixes the following issues:

Security issues fixed:

- CVE-2018-19475: Fixed bypass of an intended access restriction in psi/zdevice2.c (bsc#1117327)
- CVE-2018-19476: Fixed bypass of an intended access restriction in psi/zicc.c (bsc#1117313)
- CVE-2018-19477: Fixed bypass of an intended access restriction in psi/zfjbig2.c (bsc#1117274)
- CVE-2018-19409: Check if another device is used correctly in LockSafetyParams (bsc#1117022)
- CVE-2018-18284: Fixed potential sandbox escape through 1Policy operator (bsc#1112229)
- CVE-2018-18073: Fixed leaks through operator in saved execution stacks (bsc#1111480)
- CVE-2018-17961: Fixed a -dSAFER sandbox escape by bypassing executeonly (bsc#1111479)
- CVE-2018-17183: Fixed a potential code injection by specially crafted PostScript files (bsc#1109105)

Version update to 9.26 (bsc#1117331):

- Security issues have been the primary focus
- Minor bug fixes and improvements
- For release summary see: http://www.ghostscript.com/doc/9.26/News.htm
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: Artifex Ghostscript before 9.25 allowed a user-writable error exception table, which could be used by remote attackers able to supply crafted PostScript to potentially overwrite or replace error handlers to inject code.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Artifex Ghostscript 9.25 and earlier allows attackers to bypass a sandbox protection mechanism via vectors involving errorhandler setup. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2018-17183.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Artifex Ghostscript allows attackers to bypass a sandbox protection mechanism by leveraging exposure of system operators in the saved execution stack in an error object.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: psi/zdevice2.c in Artifex Ghostscript before 9.26 allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions because available stack space is not checked when the device remains the same.

notes.text: psi/zfjbig2.c in Artifex Ghostscript before 9.26 allows remote attackers to bypass intended access restrictions because of a JBIG2Decode type confusion.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
